reviews.text: Having a late international flight arrive in Sydney and flying to Melbourne early the next day, we booked a room here.
reviews.title: Price is what you pay, value is what you get.

reviews.text: I'm writing this review, lying awake at 5.33am because the guest next door has the tv on loud, but can also hear "every" movement as he visits the toilet/bathroom. I can hear him put the remote down after flicking through every station and finally selecting a documentary about national identity. I can hear HIS NEWSPAPER RUSTLE AS HE TURNS EACH PAGE!! I can also hear him placing his glass on the table after taking a gulp and a big "ahhh" at the end. Whilst he may be feeling refreshed, its not having the same effect on me. From an accoustic perspective, I've stayed in backpacker dorms that were quieter. Lucky we weren't on the street, but we could still hear cars, trucks and other vehicles trundle along the road.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: Look this place is clean, the guy at front desk was helpful with my wife sorting out the shuttle to the airport but I'll never stay here again, ever. It's worth paying an extra $50 to stay where you can get a restful nights sleep and look forward to the next day's flight.
reviews.title: Not too bad if staying alone

reviews.text: But more fool us, for staying in a hotel with 2/5 on TripAdvisor and expecting SOME level of quality.
reviews.title: The worst hotel. (Airport Hotel Sydney) 185 Princes Highway, Arncliffe.

reviews.text: Conveniently located to the Sydney International terminal, low cost, clean and friendly. Has a decent and well- priced restaurant attached (The Italian Job), with a limited menu, but otherwise good food. Shuttle service to, but not from the airport.
reviews.title: paper thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Am always looking for cheap accommodation and am not particular about fancy decor, as long as the room is clean, but this place was altogether too noisy. We could hear the people in the next room talking in quite low voices, synchronised our TV with their program so we had stereo sound, and knew when the people upstairs had showers or used the toilet by the very loud rushing water sounds overhead. When you want a good night's sleep before a long plane journey it's not ideal. The shuttle service was good, and the staff pleasant.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: I stayed herem with my father, on our journey to and from Karratha. We could see that they had gone to some effort to make the whole complex look good. The cafe connected with the hotel was convenient and easy. We both thought the food was very good. We really enjoyed all our meals there and not having to go very far to get it. The service was also very good on our first stay The rooms were clean and styled well. The beds were comfortable but it felt like your neighbours were in the same room with you. Surprisingly they went to all the effort of fixing the place up and did not insulate the room. The first room we had kids and adults making noise until after midnight and in the second room it was the busy traffic and the TV next door.
reviews.title: Pretty nice place but surprisingly no noise insulation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very simple rooms, but ok for a quick stop over between flights. Room was clean, and there's free wifi. About a $20 cab ride from the domestic airport, so not really that close. International terminal is closer.
reviews.title: Noisy, but ok for use one night

reviews.text: Biggest problem is the noise from the busy street outside. Wouldn't stay here if your a light sleeper.
reviews.title: Recharge in comfort, privacy, cleanliness and safety

reviews.text: I only stayed here 1 night and so didn't really get a feel for the place, and probably ought not to have reviewed my experience, ( but here is my two cents worth anyway ) because the place impressed as very positive, caring, honest and responsive.
reviews.title: sewerage sympony

reviews.text: Great location for the airport, has been refurbished but it is the worst motel we have stayed at for road noise and we have stayed at many. I could feel the trucks vibration in my chest. They need double glazed windows. Also the walls really are paper thin U CAN HEAR everything.
reviews.title: Location only
Good option for one night
reviews.text: Located a short bus ride from the internation terminal its a good value for one night. Rooms are small but nice decorated. There is hot water and coffee in the room but no cups.. Free wifi worked well in the room. Staff not that friendly at all

Rooms have been renovated to squeeze in every $ they can earn. I had to place my phone on the sink which was next to the bed. Unfortunately, also had a room right on the busy highway at an intersection. I mean I may as well have been standing on the footpath. Rooms are clean and tidy and the attached restaurant was very nice. Airport shuttle was very handy.
reviews.title: Road Service

reviews.text: The room is nice, the toilet is comfotable, the shower is great...
reviews.title: Road noise is unbearable!

reviews.text: But I could not sleep! The road noise through the single-pane glass windows was so loud! Main road outside with trucks and cars ALL NIGHT!!!
reviews.title: Can manage an overnight here if its a bed you want

reviews.text: Stayed there last month because proximity to airport. Used to be a hotel/pub before someone come along and turned it into a motel/hotel. Rooms are extremely small but clean with modern amenities. One restaurant is Italian. A short taxi ride away is Rockdale where you can get most things to eat or drink. There is no hotel parking available, find something on the street in this very busy and noisy area. If you want the shuttle bus to the airport it will cost you $8 dollars, even if you are a guest. There is no lobby to talk of, just a small booth where you check in. Could find better value elsewhere for less cost. I wouldnt not stay there again.
reviews.title: Thanks but no thanks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our stay was on april 7th and 8th....we found the place not too bad at all...the lady at the counter was quite nice ,friendly and helpful to us at all times..gave us great direction how to get to the footy at Kogarah...we had absolutely no problem with our room (107)..air con was great...shower was great....we did hear the toilet upstairs flush a few times but no drama...we ate at the restaurant on the Saturday night but had a really nice thai take away on the sunday night..the best thai we have actually eaten so far....parked around the corner in a small parking bay for 2 days for free...due to track work on railway caught free buses to and from the city Saturday and free buses to and from the city on sunday......would certainly stay here again.,
reviews.title: suited our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed this hotel 1 night. The cleaness is v good and the room decoration is new and modern. But I cant sleep well, as traffic noise pollution from nearby carriageway made hassle to me. The window layer should increase thicness in order to minimize nuisance. The location is very good. It is just only one stop from Terminal 1 by 400 bus.
reviews.title: Modern room decoration, but noise hassle from traffic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first saw the hotel exterior and location on a busy corner with lots of truck traffic we was concerned. However the interior was a pleasant surprise. We were greeted by a male receptionist that was very friendly and helpful. All Sydney hotels are over priced. This one is considered a budget hotel at $113.AUD/nt. It is along the lines of an Ibis only better. It appears to have had a recent and complete renovation. Our room was of modern design and clean with nice fixtures in the bath. We apprieciated the $8.00 shuttle service to the airport at 4:00am. Only a 5 minute walk to Arncliff Train Station for trains to all parts of Sydney and beyond. There is a nice Thai restrauant across the street from the train station that has their menus in the hotel lobby. Italian restrauant located in hotel building.
reviews.title: Don't judge a book by it's cover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it is a quite basic hotel 5-8 minutes drive from the international terminal. rooms are small, but quite ok. the worst thing is that windows don't block any noise from street at all. i really mean it - at all. there are some issues about hot water as well - it needs to flow for more than 15 minutes to become really warm/hot. probably nothing appalling when you are aware of this peculiarity, but when you aren't - you just think they have no hot water for some reason
reviews.title: basic is the right word for it, but extremely poor noise-proof spoils the otherwise decent value proposition
